bibl.title: Letter from [Mabel H. Lazear] to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 11, 1902

div1.p: Mabel Lazear writes with news of the children. She also discusses her efforts regarding the pension as well as Lazear Memorial efforts.

div1.head: Letter from [Mabel H. Lazear] to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, February 11, 1902
div1.p:
I was
so pleased with my
sweater and night-
gown- I danced for
joy when the Postman
came -- and my Post-
cards too I was so
please with- Please
thank Aunt Kate-
I had a very nice
Birthday -- and when
I get older I know
I will so much appre-
ciate your goodness
in putting something
in the Bank for me-
I had a cake with three
candles -- and a nice
big engine and an
number of other things
Thank you so
much for sending
what I so much
wanted and needed.

On my own account
I should like to ask
if you will be so
kind as to send out
for a friend the
number of stitches
for the Babie's sweater

It is very exciting about
the arrival in the
Turnbull family-

We shall await very
anxiously your ac-
count of Nell's
'coming out' or rather
'Going in' party-

We were glad to
have your good letter
this morning- So sorry
about Francis- Hope
is he entirely recovered
by this time-

I had a letter from
Mr Marbury saying
the Bill had been
favorably reported
by the and he hoped
soon to get it through
the House and then
it must journey
through the Senate
and finally to the
President- I have
had many good letters
from enough dis-
tinguished people
to make me feel
quite how kind
people can be- Mr
Pillsbury has been
in Washington which
RC
L
I think accounts for
the Bill at last being
taken up- I know
he told a friend
that he should go
on to see to it that
things were going
too slowly- Now that
he is coming home it
remains to be seen
whether it ever go
through or not
He Congressman Pearre only succeeded
in getting $17 for me
and two for each of
the children- I shall
let you know if I hear
anything further-

Did I tell you I have
had several letters about
the Memorial -- As
they have $2,400.- They
think now by making
an effort they can get
enough for a scholar-
ship- This I think
would be fine-

Mother had a letter
from Jun saying they
were thinking of going
to Europe this summer.

I should be perfectly
satisfied with the country.

I go out so much with
the children now that
it makes me long more
than ever to have
them in the country
instead of on the
street- I have had
a nurse who sew
very well so I have
had her sewing while
I took the children out.
